intro.description:
Welcome in this Quick Start Tutorial.
You will learn how to create an experiment based on an ADWin Gold hardware configuration. Then you will add a Subject to this experiment. This Subject will contain one session with ten trials.

item.title: Create an experiment
item.description:
Select menu item File > New > Experiment
Enter " NewExperiment " as experiment name and an optional description of this experiment. You could type " Quick start tutorial experiment " for instance.

item.title: Select created experiment
item.description: In the Experiments View, select this new created experiment. If the Experiments View is not visible, then select menu item Window > Show > Experiments View and select the new created experiment in this view.

item.title: Add an hardware configuration
item.description:
Select menu item File > New > DACQ Configuration
Enter " ADWinGold " as DACQ configuration name, " ADWinGold hardware configuration " as optional description and select ADWin as configuration, then click Finish

item.title: Configure this DACQ Configuration
item.description:
Open this newly created DACQ file (double click on the file or right click and click on menu item Open)
Browse to ADBasicCompiler executable and ADWin9 bootloader to specify these absolute paths. Depending on your ADWin System, it could also be ADWinA or ADWinB bootloader.
Libraries Path must point to the ADWinIncludeFiles folder which is in you Docometre installation directory. Configure this absolute path if not already done.
Then select the ADBasic version you have.
If you don't plan to use ADWin TCPIP server, do not modify the TCPIP server number. Change it accordingly to your needs if you plan to access ADWin system over this TCPIP server.
You must then specify ADwin Gold IP address (often something like 192.168.0.x), TCPIP port (generally 6543) and the Device number specified when you installed ADWinGold using ADConfig.
You can left unchanged Time out value to 1s. Select Gold as Device type and I as CPU type. Of course, these two last parameters depend on your hardware systems (ADwinPro/Gold, CPU I/II).
Leave Global frequency to 2KHz.
In Module Configuration Panel, you should at least have one line with an analog inputs module, just specify the correct module revision number and double click on the line or select "Analog inputs #1" panel.

item.title: Configure Analog input module
item.description:
In this panel you will have to configure some global module parameters and some others specific to an analog input.
Global module parameters
Here you will have to select the CAN range : ±10V, ±5V or [0-10]V.
Analog input
In the Channels Configuration section title bar, click on add icon to add an analog input channel.

item.title: Add a subject with a session of ten trials
item.description:
In the Experiments View, select the created experiment then select menu item File > New > Subject
Enter " John_DOE " as subject name and an optional description, then click Finish
Select " John_DOE " Subject in the experiment view, then select menu item File > New > Session
Enter " Session1 " as session name, an optional description and ten as trials number, then click Finish
